Experience

Santa Clara, CA
June 2019 - August 2019

Centrify Corporation - Software Development Intern

As a Software Development Intern for Centrify Corporation, a computer security company with products for privileged access management (PAM) and multi-factor authentication (MFA), I fixed bugs, using JIRA issue tracking software and Perforce version control software. Additionally, I wrote unit tests in Go. One of my biggest accomplishments during my time at Centrify was restructuring the codebase to use interfaces and introducing mocks in unit tests to increase code coverage of unit tests.

biggest takeaways: Go, Unit Tests, Mocks, JIRA, Perforce
Socorro, NM
June 2018 - July 2018

The Summer Science Program - Astrophysics Researcher

As one of 36 students chosen to attend the 2018 Summer Science Program in Astrophysics in New Mexico, I used Etscorn Observatory's Celestron-14 telescope to observe near-Earth asteroid 2002 UX and calculate its position (in right ascension and declination) throughout the summer. Due to its dimness, 2002 UX was a particularly difficult asteroid to track.

With data collected from observations of the asteroid, I used Python to determine the asteroid's six orbital elements that uniquely define its orbit through the iterative Method of Gauss. I used differential correction to improve calculations of the orbital elements, and calculated the uncertainties of the orbital elements with Monte Carlo sampling. I successfully determined the orbit of 2002 UX, in addition to visualizing its orbit.

Additionally, I used Swift integration software to perform orbital integration and run multiple simulations to determine what might happen to 2002 UX after many years. I discovered that 2002 UX had probabilities of colliding with the Earth, Sun, Venus, and Mars, which may impact the solar system, as well as the properties of each of these bodies.

My team published the data we had collected on the positions of asteroid 2002 UX in the Minor Planet Center Supplement: Lum M., Noel A., & Valadez C. 2018, “New Observations of Near-Earth Asteroid 283729 (2002 UX),” M.P.S. 906049.

biggest takeaways: Astrophysics, Telescope Techniques, Python, Orbit Determination (Method of Gauss), differential correction, Monte Carlo sampling
Davis, CA
July 2017 - August 2017

California State Summer School for Mathematics & Science (COSMOS) UC Davis - Researcher

At COSMOS UC Davis, I was in Cluster 1: Quantum Mechanics and Applications to Nanotechnology. I learned to program in C and also learned basics in electronics. My time at COSMOS culminated in a final project of building a scanning tunneling microscope (STM) to take 3D images of surfaces at the atomic level. The STM uses the quantum effect of tunneling by applying a voltage between the STM's conducting tip and the surface of the sample being studied. This voltage sends electrons to the sample surface. On the electronics side, I built a 15V power supply. I also used C for the software side of the project. My STM successfully took images of samples at microscopic levels and could be potentially used to conduct more research in the sphere of nanotechnology.

biggest takeaways: C, Electronics, Quantum Mechanics, Nanotechnology
San Jose, CA
August 2016 - June 2019

the Epic newspaper - Editor-in-Chief

As the Editor-in-Chief of the Epic, the Lynbrook High School student newspaper, I oversaw 38 student journalists and 5 sections (news, opinion, features, in-depth, and sports), online and in print (8 issues per year). My responsibilities included directing the newspaper in my vision; representing the newspaper professionally; maintaining relationships with school administration and other community members; editing articles multiple times per issue cycle; teaching staffers how to write journalistically, conduct interviews, and use graphic design software; and providing staffers with feedback on their articles, layouts, and teamwork. During my time on staff, I wrote and published 20+ articles, created layouts using Adobe Photoshop and InDesign, and took numerous photographs to accompany articles. I was Opinion Section Editor for the 2017-2018 school year, and then Editor-in-Chief for the 2018-2019 school year.

the Epic is an award-winning newspaper:

  • Crown Award from Columbia Scholastic Press Association (CSPA) (awarded in 2020 for publications released in the 2018-2019 school year)
  • 1st Award from American Scholastic Press Association (ASPA) (2017, 2018)
  • 1st Place with Special Merit from ASPA (2019)
  • 10th in Best of Show at Journalism Education Association (JEA)/National Scholastic Press Association (NSPA) National High School Journalism Convention (2018)
  • Honorable Mention in Commentary Writing (Individual Award) at JEA/NSPA National High School Journalism Convention (2018)

View past print issues of the Epic here.

View the Epic website here.

View my personal portfolio of my work from my time as part of the Epic here.

biggest takeaways: Journalism, Writing, AP Style, Editing, Layout & Design - Adobe Photoshop & InDesign, Photography, Leadership, Communication, Teamwork

I built this website using HTML, CSS, Sass, and JavaScript.
